Animals.description: The largest and most formidable freshwater predator of Africa, the Goliath Tiger Fish inhabits the Congo River basin. With enormous teeth and immense strength, it preys on large fish and occasionally small mammals near the water.

Animals.name: Mekong Giant Barb
Animals.description: The largest freshwater fish in Southeast Asia, the Mekong Giant Barb inhabits the Mekong River. A peaceful herbivore, it feeds on plants and small invertebrates, but its massive size makes it a formidable presence and difficult prey for predators.

Animals.name: Mekong Giant Catfish
Animals.description: One of the largest freshwater fish in the world, the Mekong Giant Catfish inhabits the Mekong River in Southeast Asia. A peaceful filter-feeder, it primarily consumes plankton and plant matter, but its enormous size makes it nearly invulnerable to most natural predators.

Animals.name: Goonch Catfish
Animals.description: A massive predatory catfish native to rivers of South and Southeast Asia. The Goonch Catfish feeds on fish, mammals, and other riverine animals, using stealth and immense strength to overpower prey.

Animals.name: Wallago Catfish
Animals.description: A large freshwater catfish found in South and Southeast Asian rivers. Wallago Catfish are aggressive predators, feeding on fish, amphibians, and occasionally small mammals, using speed and stealth to ambush prey.

Animals.name: Channel Catfish
Animals.description: A medium-sized freshwater catfish native to North America. Highly adaptable, it thrives in rivers and lakes, feeding on fish, insects, and small crustaceans. Channel Catfish are known for their sharp spines and excellent sense of smell.

Animals.name: Flathead Catfish
Animals.description: A large North American catfish that prefers to lurk near the riverbed. Flathead Catfish are solitary predators, ambushing prey such as fish and crayfish. Their broad, flat heads give them a powerful bite and excellent camouflage.

Animals.name: Golden Mahseer
Animals.description: A legendary freshwater fish of South and Southeast Asian rivers, prized for its golden scales and immense strength. Known as the “tiger of the river,” the Golden Mahseer is both a fierce predator and a symbol of power in its ecosystem.

Animals.name: Vundu Catfish
Animals.description: A massive African catfish found in rivers and lakes across sub-Saharan Africa. Vundu are opportunistic feeders, consuming fish, crustaceans, and even carrion. They are among the largest freshwater fish in Africa, known for their endurance and adaptability.

Animals.name: Amazon Redtail Catfish
Animals.description: A striking South American giant, the Amazon Redtail Catfish is easily recognized by its bright red tail and massive size. Found in rivers, lakes, and flooded forests of the Amazon Basin, it is an aggressive bottom-dweller that preys on fish, crustaceans, and anything it can swallow whole.

Animals.name: Blue Catfish
Animals.description: The largest catfish native to North America, Blue Catfish thrive in rivers and reservoirs. Known for their endurance and strength, they are powerful swimmers that feed on fish, mussels, and invertebrates. Their adaptability has made them an invasive species in some regions.

Animals.name: Wels Catfish
Animals.description: One of the largest freshwater fish in Europe, the Wels Catfish can grow to enormous sizes and dominate its ecosystem. Opportunistic and sometimes aggressive, it feeds on fish, waterfowl, and even small mammals. Its sheer bulk and power make it a true river monster.

Animals.name: Atlantic Stingray
Animals.description: A medium-sized stingray found in coastal waters, estuaries, and occasionally rivers along the western Atlantic. Recognizable by its diamond-shaped body and venomous tail spine, the Atlantic Stingray feeds on small invertebrates buried in the sand.

Animals.name: Black Diamond Stingray
Animals.description: A striking freshwater stingray native to the Xingu River in Brazil, the Black Diamond Stingray is prized for its black body covered in brilliant white spots. It feeds on crustaceans, mollusks, and small fish, using stealth and sudden strikes to capture prey.

Animals.name: Giant Whiptail Stingray
Animals.description: The largest freshwater stingray in the world, the Giant Whiptail Stingray can grow over 5 meters across and weigh several hundred kilograms. Found in Southeast Asian rivers, it is a bottom-dweller that feeds on fish, crustaceans, and mollusks, using its immense size and whip-like tail for defense.

Animals.name: Pearl River Stingray
Animals.description: A freshwater stingray found in the Pearl River system of China. This medium-sized stingray prefers sandy or muddy bottoms and feeds on crustaceans, mollusks, and small fish. Its patterned body allows it to blend into the riverbed for ambush hunting.

Animals.name: Black Piranha
Animals.description: A predatory freshwater fish of South America’s rivers, especially the Amazon Basin. Known for its razor-sharp teeth and ferocious feeding behavior, the Black Piranha preys on fish, insects, and small vertebrates, often striking in coordinated attacks.

Animals.name: Red-bellied Piranha
Animals.description: One of the most famous Amazonian predators, the Red-bellied Piranha is notorious for its sharp teeth and feeding frenzies. It hunts in schools, feeding on fish, insects, and occasionally small mammals or birds.

Animals.name: Grass Carp
Animals.description: A large freshwater carp native to East Asia. Grass Carp are primarily herbivorous, feeding on aquatic plants, and play an important role in controlling vegetation in rivers and lakes. Despite their peaceful diet, they can grow very large and have strong swimming ability.

Animals.name: Mirror Carp
Animals.description: A domesticated variant of common carp, Mirror Carp are found in rivers, lakes, and ponds worldwide. They are known for their large, reflective scales and calm, bottom-feeding behavior. While not aggressive predators, their size and endurance make them tough opponents in territorial disputes.

Animals.name: Bighead Carp
Animals.description: A large freshwater carp native to East Asia, the Bighead Carp primarily feeds on plankton. Known for its enormous head and fast growth, it is often introduced to control algae in lakes and rivers. While peaceful, its size and schooling behavior make it a dominant presence in freshwater habitats.

Animals.name: Common Carp
Animals.description: One of the most widespread freshwater fish in the world, Common Carp are native to Europe and Asia but have been introduced globally. They are omnivorous bottom feeders, eating plants, insects, and detritus, and are known for their resilience and adaptability.

Animals.name: Asian Stinging Catfish
Animals.description: A small but venomous freshwater catfish found across South and Southeast Asia. Known for its sharp dorsal spines that deliver venom, it feeds on insects, small fish, and detritus, using agility and venomous strikes to defend itself.

Animals.name: Nile Tilapia
Animals.description: A widely distributed freshwater fish native to Africa but introduced worldwide. Tilapia are omnivorous and highly adaptable, feeding on plants, insects, and small invertebrates. Their hardiness and schooling behavior make them resilient in rivers, lakes, and reservoirs.

Animals.name: Swamp Barb
Animals.description: A small freshwater fish native to South and Southeast Asia, often found in rivers, swamps, and flooded fields. Swamp Barbs are fast, schooling fish that feed on insects, small crustaceans, and plant matter.

Animals.name: Catla
Animals.description: A large freshwater carp native to rivers and lakes of South Asia. Catla are primarily surface feeders, consuming plankton and small fish. They are fast-growing and form an important part of riverine and aquaculture ecosystems.

Animals.name: Rohu
Animals.description: A major freshwater carp of South Asia, Rohu is an important species for rivers, lakes, and aquaculture. It feeds on plankton and plant matter, growing large and forming dense schools that provide both food and ecological balance.

Animals.name: Australian Longfin Eel
Animals.description: A large freshwater eel native to rivers, lakes, and estuaries of eastern Australia. Longfin Eels are nocturnal predators, feeding on fish, crustaceans, and invertebrates. They are renowned for their endurance, ability to migrate long distances, and slippery, agile movements.

Animals.name: Australian Shortfin Eel
Animals.description: A medium-sized freshwater eel found in rivers, lakes, and estuaries across Australia and New Zealand. Shortfin Eels are nocturnal predators, feeding on fish, insects, and crustaceans. They are known for their quick movements and ability to navigate complex aquatic environments.

Animals.name: African Pike
Animals.description: A freshwater predator native to rivers and lakes across Africa. African Pike are solitary hunters, feeding on smaller fish and invertebrates. They rely on stealth and sudden bursts of speed to ambush prey, making them agile and formidable hunters in their habitats.

Animals.name: Northern Pike
Animals.description: A large freshwater predator native to rivers, lakes, and marshes across North America, Europe, and parts of Asia. Northern Pike are ambush hunters, feeding on fish, amphibians, and occasionally small mammals. Their speed and sharp teeth make them top predators in their ecosystems.

Animals.name: Walleye
Animals.description: A freshwater predator native to rivers and lakes of North America. Walleye are known for their excellent vision in low light and feed on smaller fish, insects, and crustaceans. They are agile hunters, often striking under the cover of darkness.

Animals.name: Pikehandle Barracuda
Animals.description: A predatory fish of coastal and estuarine waters in the western Atlantic and Caribbean. Pikehandle Barracudas are fast, aggressive hunters, feeding on smaller fish with sudden bursts of speed. They are agile and rely on ambush tactics to capture prey.

Animals.name: Great Barracuda
Animals.description: A powerful predator of tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide, the Great Barracuda is known for its torpedo-like body and fearsome jaws. With lightning-fast strikes and sharp teeth, it preys on fish, squid, and occasionally smaller marine animals. Its intimidating presence has earned it a reputation as one of the ocean’s most aggressive hunters.

Animals.name: Beluga Sturgeon
Animals.description: A large freshwater predator native to rivers, lakes, and marshes across North America, Europe, and parts of Asia. Northern Pike are ambush hunters, feeding on fish, amphibians, and occasionally small mammals. Their speed and sharp teeth make them top predators in their ecosystems.

Animals.name: White Sturgeon
Animals.description: The largest freshwater fish in North America, the White Sturgeon can live for over a century and reach massive sizes. Dwelling in deep rivers and estuaries, it feeds on fish, mollusks, and crustaceans. Its slow but deliberate movements are backed by tremendous strength, making it a dominant presence in its habitat.

Animals.name: Butterfly Peacock Bass
Animals.description: A colorful predatory cichlid native to South America, especially the Amazon Basin. The Butterfly Peacock Bass is admired for its bright patterns and aggressive hunting style. It feeds on fish and crustaceans, striking with speed and precision. Popular among anglers, it’s both a beautiful and formidable freshwater predator.

Animals.name: Chinese Seerfish
Animals.description: A fast, predatory mackerel found in the coastal and estuarine waters of the South China Sea and surrounding regions. Known for its streamlined body and sharp teeth, the Chinese Seerfish preys on small fish and squid, relying on bursts of speed to ambush and chase down its meals. It is a prized fish for both commercial fishing and sport.

Animals.name: Chinook Salmon
Animals.description: The largest of the Pacific salmon, Chinook are powerful swimmers known for their epic migrations from the ocean into freshwater rivers to spawn. They are opportunistic predators, feeding on smaller fish, squid, and crustaceans in the ocean before expending their strength in upriver journeys. Highly valued for both their ecological role and as a prized catch.

Animals.name: Coho Salmon
Animals.description: Also called the Silver Salmon, the Coho is a smaller but agile member of the Pacific salmon family. Known for its silvery body and powerful jumps, it thrives in both marine and freshwater environments. Coho feed on fish and invertebrates in the ocean before migrating upriver to spawn, where they display bright red coloration.

Animals.name: Largemouth Bass
Animals.description: A highly adaptable freshwater predator native to North America, Largemouth Bass are one of the most popular sport fish worldwide. They thrive in lakes, rivers, and swamps, using stealth and sudden bursts of speed to prey on fish, frogs, insects, and even small birds. Their aggressive feeding behavior makes them formidable hunters in their habitats.

Animals.name: Orinoco Peacock Bass
Animals.description: A striking and aggressive predatory fish from the Orinoco River Basin, the Orinoco Peacock Bass is renowned for its vivid coloration and fierce hunting style. It preys primarily on smaller fish, using ambush tactics and explosive bursts of speed. Highly prized by anglers, it is one of the most iconic freshwater game fish of South America.

Animals.name: Giant Trevally
Animals.description: A powerful predatory jack of the Indo-Pacific, the Giant Trevally dominates coral reefs, coastal zones, and open waters. It hunts both alone and in groups, preying on fish, squid, and even birds, known for its explosive bursts of speed and raw power. Revered as a trophy fish, it is considered one of the toughest fighters in the ocean.

Animals.name: Ruby Snapper
Animals.description: A deepwater predator found across the Indo-Pacific, the Ruby Snapper is known for its striking reddish coloration and adaptability to depths over 100 meters. Feeding on fish, squid, and crustaceans, it is both a skilled hunter and a valuable commercial fish. Its endurance and strength make it a respected inhabitant of reef slopes and offshore waters.

Animals.name: Silver Carp
Animals.description: A fast-growing freshwater carp native to East Asia. Silver Carp feed primarily on plankton and detritus, forming dense schools that can impact river ecosystems. Though peaceful, their size and numbers make them ecologically dominant in many rivers and lakes.

Animals.name: Danube Salmon
Animals.description: Also called Huchen, the Danube Salmon is a large, predatory salmonid native to the Danube and other European rivers. It feeds on fish, insects, and small amphibians, using stealth and bursts of speed to ambush prey. Considered a trophy fish, it is one of Europe’s most iconic freshwater predators.

Animals.name: Siberian Taimen
Animals.description: The largest salmonid in the world, the Siberian Taimen inhabits rivers across Siberia and Mongolia. A solitary apex predator, it feeds on fish, small mammals, and birds, striking with immense power and speed. Its size, strength, and endurance make it a dominant force in cold freshwater ecosystems.

Animals.name: Florida Gar
Animals.description: A medium-sized gar native to freshwater rivers, lakes, and swamps of Florida. Florida Gars are ambush predators, feeding on fish, crustaceans, and insects. Their elongated body and armored scales make them resilient hunters in shallow waters.

Animals.name: Longnose Gar
Animals.description: A large North American gar, the Longnose Gar inhabits rivers, lakes, and bayous. Known for its elongated snout filled with sharp teeth, it is an ambush predator feeding on fish, crustaceans, and occasionally small amphibians. Its armored scales provide strong protection against attacks.

Animals.name: Spotted Gar
Animals.description: A medium-sized North American gar found in rivers, lakes, and swamps. Spotted Gars are ambush predators feeding on fish, insects, and crustaceans. Their distinctive spots help them blend into murky waters, making them effective stealth hunters.

Animals.name: Green Sawfish
Animals.description: A large, critically endangered sawfish found in coastal and riverine waters of the Indo-Pacific. It uses its long, toothed snout to detect and incapacitate prey such as fish and crustaceans. Despite its slow swimming speed, its strength and specialized rostrum make it a formidable predator.

Animals.name: Largetooth Sawfish
Animals.description: One of the largest and most powerful sawfish species, the Largetooth Sawfish inhabits rivers, estuaries, and coastal waters worldwide. It uses its long, toothed snout to stun and incapacitate fish and crustaceans. Despite being slow-moving, its immense strength and armored body make it a top predator in its habitats.

Animals.name: American Gizzard Shad
Animals.description: A common freshwater fish of North America, found in rivers, lakes, and reservoirs. Gizzard Shad feed on plankton and detritus, forming large schools that help protect them from predators. Though small, they are ecologically important as a primary food source for larger fish and birds.

Animals.name: Bigmouth Buffalo
Animals.description: A large freshwater fish native to North American rivers and lakes. Bigmouth Buffalo are primarily filter feeders, consuming plankton and detritus. They can grow very large and are long-lived, making them an important species in freshwater ecosystems.

Animals.name: Sterlet
Animals.description: A small sturgeon native to rivers of Eastern Europe and Western Asia. Sterlets feed on small fish, invertebrates, and detritus. Though much smaller than other sturgeons, they are valued for their caviar and play a role in maintaining river ecosystem balance.

Animals.name: Black Drum
Animals.description: A large coastal and estuarine fish found along the Atlantic and Gulf coasts of North America. Black Drum feed on crustaceans, mollusks, and small fish, using their strong jaws to crush prey. They are slow-moving but resilient, making them a notable predator in their habitats.

Animals.name: Lake Sturgeon
Animals.description: A large freshwater sturgeon native to North American lakes and rivers. Lake Sturgeon are slow but powerful, feeding on fish, mollusks, and crustaceans. Known for their longevity and size, they are important apex fish in their habitats.

Animals.name: Smooth-head Blobfish
Animals.description: A gelatinous deep-sea fish found off the coasts of Australia and Tasmania. Smooth-head Blobfish are adapted to high-pressure environments and feed on small invertebrates. Their soft body makes them highly resilient to crushing pressure but slow-moving.

Animals.name: Bluegill
Animals.description: A small freshwater sunfish native to North America. Bluegill are schooling fish feeding on insects, small crustaceans, and plankton. They are agile and form the base of many freshwater food chains.

Animals.name: Bowfin
Animals.description: A primitive freshwater predator native to North American rivers, lakes, and swamps. Bowfins feed on fish, amphibians, and crustaceans. They are ambush predators with strong, elongated bodies and sharp teeth, making them effective hunters in their habitats.

Animals.name: Brown Bullhead Catfish
Animals.description: A small to medium-sized freshwater catfish native to North America. Brown Bullheads are bottom feeders, eating insects, small fish, and detritus. They are hardy and adapt well to various freshwater environments, including rivers, lakes, and swamps.

Animals.name: Piraiba
Animals.description: One of the largest catfish in the Amazon, the Piraiba inhabits rivers and lakes across South America. A powerful predator, it feeds on fish and small aquatic animals, using its immense size and strength to dominate its environment.

Animals.name: Walking Catfish
Animals.description: A small to medium freshwater catfish native to Southeast Asia. Walking Catfish are known for their ability to traverse land in search of water. They feed on fish, insects, and detritus, making them versatile predators in their habitats.

Animals.name: African Cheetah
Animals.description: The fastest land animal on Earth, native to African savannahs and grasslands. Cheetahs rely on explosive speed and agility to hunt antelope and other small to medium prey. Despite their incredible speed, they have moderate stamina and low defense.

Animals.name: Aardwolf
Animals.description: A small African mammal related to hyenas, feeding primarily on termites and insects. Aardwolves are nocturnal and rely on stealth to forage.

Animals.name: African Golden Cat
Animals.description: A medium-sized wild cat native to West and Central African forests. African Golden Cats are elusive and skilled hunters, feeding on birds, small mammals, and reptiles.

Animals.name: African Lion
Animals.description: A large apex predator native to African savannahs. Lions hunt cooperatively in prides, feeding on herbivores like zebras and antelopes. Known for strength, teamwork, and dominance in their ecosystem.

Animals.name: American Bison
Animals.description: A massive herbivore native to North American plains. Bison are social animals that graze on grasses and can defend themselves with strength and horns.

Animals.name: American Black Bear
Animals.description: A medium to large North American bear found in forests and river valleys. Omnivorous and versatile, black bears feed on plants, insects, fish, and mammals.

Animals.name: Longnose Velvet Dogfish
Animals.description: A small deep-sea shark found in North Atlantic waters. Longnose Velvet Dogfish feed on fish and cephalopods, adapted to deep, dark environments with slow swimming and ambush tactics.

Animals.name: Silver Chimaera
Animals.description: A deep-sea cartilaginous fish found in the North Pacific. Silver Chimaeras feed on smaller fish and invertebrates, using stealth and slow ambush attacks in deep waters.

Animals.name: Tropical Sawshark
Animals.description: A small tropical sawshark native to coastal waters and reefs. It uses its toothed snout to detect and slash fish and crustaceans.

Animals.name: Whalesucker
Animals.description: A small fish that attaches to larger marine animals like whales and sharks. Whalesuckers feed on parasites and scraps, gaining mobility and protection from their hosts.

Animals.name: Reef Manta Ray
Animals.description: A large ray inhabiting coral reefs and coastal waters of the Indo-Pacific. Reef Manta Rays feed on plankton and small fish while gliding gracefully, using size to deter predators.

Animals.name: Giant Oceanic Manta Ray
Animals.description: The largest species of manta ray, found in open oceans worldwide. Feeds on plankton and small fish, using massive size to dominate its territory.

Animals.name: Duckbill Eagle Ray
Animals.description: A ray species inhabiting coral reefs and coastal areas of the Indo-Pacific. Feeds on crustaceans and small fish, using gliding movements to ambush prey.

Animals.name: White-spotted Eagle Ray
Animals.description: A large ray found in tropical and subtropical reefs. White-spotted Eagle Rays feed on mollusks and crustaceans, using powerful tail strikes and gliding to hunt.

Animals.name: Ocean Sunfish
Animals.description: One of the largest bony fish, Ocean Sunfish inhabit open oceans worldwide. They feed on jellyfish and plankton and rely on size and thick skin for protection.

Animals.name: Manchurian Trout
Animals.description: A freshwater salmonid native to Siberian and East Asian rivers. Lenok feed on smaller fish and invertebrates, using speed and ambush tactics in cold waters.

Animals.name: Crocodile Catfish
Animals.description: A large freshwater catfish resembling a small crocodile. Crocodile Catfish are apex predators, feeding on fish, amphibians, and small mammals in rivers and lakes.

Animals.name: Highland Copperhead
Animals.description: A venomous snake native to the highlands of southeastern Australia. Highland Copperheads hunt small mammals, birds, and amphibians, using stealth and venom to immobilize prey.

Animals.name: Togian Babirusa
Animals.description: A wild pig native to the Togian Islands of Indonesia. Known for its distinctive tusks and strong body, it feeds on roots, fruits, and small animals in forests and swamps.

Animals.name: African Wild Dog
Animals.description: An African carnivore known for cooperative hunting in packs. African Wild Dogs hunt antelopes and other medium-sized prey, relying on stamina, teamwork, and strategy.

Animals.name: Dingo
Animals.description: A wild dog native to Australia, dingoes are adaptable hunters feeding on mammals, birds, and reptiles. They are fast, intelligent, and opportunistic predators.

Animals.name: Tasmanian Devil
Animals.description: A carnivorous marsupial native to Tasmania. Tasmanian Devils feed on carrion and small animals, known for powerful jaws, aggressive behavior, and loud screeches.

Animals.name: Brandts Cormorant
Animals.description: A large seabird found along the Pacific Coast of North America. Brandts Cormorants are skilled divers, feeding on fish and invertebrates under the sea.

Animals.name: Double-crested Cormorant
Animals.description: A widespread North American waterbird that dives underwater to catch fish. They thrive in lakes, rivers, and coasts.

Animals.name: Sea Otter
Animals.abilities: Kelp Forager  Gains defense and regeneration bonus when in kelp forests.
Animals.description: A marine mammal native to the North Pacific, sea otters are known for tool use and feeding on shellfish while floating in kelp forests.

Animals.name: Leather Star
Animals.abilities: Regenerator  Recovers health when in tidepools.
Animals.description: A starfish species of the North Pacific. It feeds on sponges and other invertebrates and is recognizable by its leathery texture.

Animals.name: Ochre Sea Star
Animals.abilities: Tidepool Titan  Gains defense when holding ground in rocky shores.
Animals.description: A keystone predator in intertidal ecosystems, feeding on mussels and barnacles. Found on rocky Pacific shores.

Animals.name: Purple Sea Urchin
Animals.abilities: Spiny Defense  Gains high defense when stationary.
Animals.description: A spiny echinoderm inhabiting tidepools and kelp forests. Purple Sea Urchins feed on algae and can drastically shape ecosystems.

Animals.name: Red Sea Urchin
Animals.abilities: Armor Spines  Boosts defense when under attack.
Animals.description: One of the largest sea urchins, found in the Pacific. Red Sea Urchins feed on kelp and are important in marine ecosystems.

Animals.name: Sunflower Star
Animals.abilities: Multi-limbed Hunter  Gains attack bonus when swarming prey with many arms.
Animals.description: A massive starfish with up to 24 arms, found in the North Pacific. It preys on sea urchins, clams, and other invertebrates.

Animals.name: Bat Star
Animals.abilities: Filter Forager  Gains health recovery when scavenging detritus.
Animals.description: A small, brightly colored sea star native to the Pacific coast. Bat Stars feed on detritus and algae.

Animals.name: Blood Star
Animals.abilities: Tidepool Forager  Gains minor regeneration in shallow waters.
Animals.description: A small red starfish found along the Pacific coast. Blood Stars primarily feed on sponges and microorganisms.

Animals.name: Cushion Star
Animals.abilities: Cushion Defense  Inflates to deter predators, gaining defense.
Animals.description: A thick-bodied starfish found in the Pacific. Its puffed-up appearance provides protection from predators.

Animals.name: Six-rayed Starfish
Animals.abilities: Six-limbed Grasp  Gains better hold on prey with six arms.
Animals.description: A small starfish of the Pacific Northwest intertidal zone. Known for its six arms and predation on mussels and barnacles.

Animals.name: Brown Smoothhound Shark
Animals.abilities: Swift Hunter  Gains speed and attack when chasing schooling fish.
Animals.description: A small houndshark of the Eastern Pacific, feeding on fish and invertebrates.

Animals.name: California Yellowtail
Animals.abilities: Schooling Predator  Gains attack bonus when hunting in groups.
Animals.description: A large schooling fish found in the Eastern Pacific. Known for speed and strength, often targeted by fishers.

Animals.name: Leopard Shark
Animals.abilities: Striped Stalker  Gains stealth and attack in shallow waters.
Animals.description: A small shark species with spotted patterns, found along the Pacific Coast of North America.

Animals.name: Great White Shark
Animals.abilities: Apex Predator  Gains huge attack bonus when ambushing large prey.
Animals.description: One of the ocean's most feared predators, Great Whites are massive sharks found worldwide in temperate waters.

Animals.name: Pacific Electric Ray
Animals.abilities: Electric Surge  Can paralyze enemies with electric shocks.
Animals.description: An electric ray native to the Pacific coast of North America. It uses strong electrical discharges to stun prey and deter predators.

Animals.name: Cabezon
Animals.abilities: Camouflage Predator  Gains stealth and attack bonus when hiding in rocky reefs.
Animals.description: A large sculpin native to the Pacific coast, known for ambushing prey among rocks and kelp.

Animals.name: Kelp Greenling
Animals.abilities: Kelp Shelter  Gains defense and evasion when hiding in kelp forests.
Animals.description: A fish species inhabiting rocky reefs and kelp forests along the Pacific Coast.

Animals.name: Rock Greenling
Animals.abilities: Rock Dweller  Gains defense when near rocky terrain.
Animals.description: A greenling fish found in rocky coastal habitats of the North Pacific.

Animals.name: Black Prickleback
Animals.abilities: Tidepool Dweller  Gains defense bonus when in shallow rocky pools.
Animals.description: A small intertidal fish found in rocky tidepools of the Pacific coast.

Animals.name: High Cockscomb
Animals.abilities: Tidepool Hider  Gains evasion in rocky crevices.
Animals.description: A small tidepool fish native to the Pacific Northwest.

Animals.name: Lingcod
Animals.abilities: Reef Ambusher  Gains attack bonus when camouflaged among kelp and rocks.
Animals.description: A large predatory fish of the Pacific coast. Lingcods are powerful hunters that ambush fish and squid.

Animals.name: Rock Gunnel
Animals.abilities: Tidepool Forager  Gains defense bonus in rocky intertidal areas.
Animals.description: A small intertidal fish native to the North Atlantic, often found in rocky shorelines.

Animals.name: Tubesnout
Animals.abilities: Schooling Shelter  Gains defense when moving in groups in kelp forests.
Animals.description: A small schooling fish of the Pacific coast, often found near kelp beds and reefs.

Animals.name: Climbing Perch
Animals.description: A freshwater fish known for its ability to survive out of water and even climb short distances.

Animals.name: Cuchia Eel
Animals.description: A swamp-dwelling eel-like fish that burrows in mud and can breathe air.

Animals.name: Dwarf Gourami
Animals.description: A small, brightly colored freshwater fish popular in aquariums.

Animals.name: Giant Gourami
Animals.description: A very large freshwater fish capable of surviving harsh conditions.

Animals.name: Giant Marbled Eel
Animals.description: A massive predatory eel with marbled skin, often found in tropical waters.

Animals.name: Three-spot Gourami
Animals.description: A freshwater fish with three distinctive spots along its body.

Animals.name: Crescent Betta
Animals.description: A peaceful but territorial betta with a crescent-shaped tail.

Animals.name: Honey Gourami
Animals.description: A small and gentle gourami with honey-gold coloration.

Animals.name: Mahachai Betta
Animals.description: A wild betta species adapted to swampy, brackish habitats.

Animals.name: Penang Betta
Animals.description: A betta species from Penang, known for its aggressive behavior.

Animals.name: Siamese Fighting Fish
Animals.description: A popular aquarium fish famous for its aggression and beauty.

Animals.name: Lyretail Killifish
Animals.description: A small killifish with a lyre-shaped tail, known for its vivid colors.

Animals.name: Mummichog
Animals.description: A small, hardy fish that thrives in polluted or harsh brackish waters.

Animals.name: Silver-lined Mudskipper
Animals.description: An amphibious fish capable of walking on land and climbing roots.

Animals.name: Turquoise Killifish
Animals.description: A brightly colored killifish known for its short lifespan and rapid growth.

Animals.name: Caribbean Box Jellyfish

Animals.description: A venomous box jellyfish found in the Caribbean, capable of inflicting painful and potentially fatal stings.

Animals.name: Deep-sea Lizardfish

Animals.description: A predatory deep-sea fish with a reptilian appearance, known for lying in wait on the ocean floor to ambush prey.

Animals.name: Flying Squid

Animals.description: A squid species capable of propelling itself above water to glide short distances, escaping predators or surprising prey.

Animals.name: Longfin Cigarfish

Animals.description: A small schooling deep-sea fish with a slender body and long fins, often found drifting in open waters.

Animals.name: Paddlenose Spookfish

Animals.description: A deep-sea chimaera with a paddle-shaped snout used for sensing prey in the dark depths.

Animals.name: Pearlside
Animals.abilities: Bioluminescence  Uses light to confuse predators.
Animals.description: A small glowing deep-sea fish that uses bioluminescence for camouflage and communication.

Animals.name: Ridgehead
Animals.abilities: Pressure Tolerance  Resistant to deep-sea pressure damage.
Animals.description: A small deep-sea fish with an armored head, adapted to survive extreme pressure environments.

Animals.name: Shoulderspine Bigscale
Animals.abilities: Spined Defense  Reduces incoming melee damage.
Animals.description: A deep-sea fish with distinctive large scales and protective spines along its body.

Animals.name: Silvery Lightfish

Animals.description: A small silvery deep-sea fish with glowing organs that emit flashes of light in the dark ocean.

Animals.name: Banded Rudderfish

Animals.description: A schooling fish often found near larger animals or floating objects, known for its striped juvenile form.

Animals.name: Bullet Tuna

Animals.description: A fast-swimming tuna species, smaller than most tunas but built for bursts of speed in open waters.

Animals.name: Cobia

Animals.description: A large predatory fish found in warm waters, known for its strong body and aggressive feeding behavior.

Animals.name: Dogtooth Tuna
Animals.abilities: Relentless Predator  Boosts attack during long chases.
Animals.description: A fierce predator tuna with sharp teeth, often hunting near reefs and in deep tropical waters.

Animals.name: Frigate Tuna
Animals.abilities: Shoal Speed  Gains speed when in schools.
Animals.description: A small but fast tuna species found in warm coastal waters, often traveling in large schools.

Animals.name: Kawakawa
Animals.abilities: Burst Swim  Gains temporary speed boost at start of chase.
Animals.description: Also known as little mackerel tuna, a small and fast-moving species that feeds on sardines and anchovies.

Animals.name: Little Tunny
Animals.abilities: Chase Instinct  Boosts attack when pursuing prey.
Animals.description: A small tuna species commonly found in the Atlantic and Mediterranean, traveling in schools.

Animals.name: Atlantic Bonito
Animals.abilities: Swift Hunter  Gains speed when targeting schools of fish.
Animals.description: A fast predator from the mackerel family, found in the Atlantic Ocean and Mediterranean Sea.

Animals.name: Blue Sprat
Animals.abilities: School Defense  Reduces damage when in groups.
Animals.description: A small schooling forage fish that forms dense shoals in tropical seas.

Animals.name: Rainbow Sardine
Animals.abilities: Shoal Spark  Increases speed in schools.
Animals.description: A brightly colored sardine species found in tropical waters, forming massive schools.

Animals.name: Round Herring
Animals.abilities: Shoal Shield  Gains defense when grouped.
Animals.description: A small schooling herring common in coastal waters, often prey for larger predators.

Animals.name: Silverside
Animals.abilities: Shoal Instinct  Boosts evasion when grouped.
Animals.description: A small silvery schooling fish, often seen jumping at the water's surface when pursued.

Animals.name: Bigeye Scad
Animals.abilities: Shoal Defense  Gains defense with allies nearby.
Animals.description: A reef-associated scad species, known for its large eyes and schooling behavior.

Animals.name: Cornetfish
Animals.abilities: Ambush Strike  Gains attack boost when surprising prey.
Animals.description: A long, slender fish with a trumpet-like snout, often ambushing smaller fish near reefs.

Animals.name: Longspine Snipefish

Animals.description: A deep reef fish with a long snout and spines, feeding on small crustaceans.

Animals.name: Oriental Flying Gurnard

Animals.description: A bottom-dwelling fish with large pectoral fins that spread like wings to scare predators.

Animals.name: Snake Mackerel
Animals.abilities: Night Hunter  Gains attack boost in low light.
Animals.description: A long and slender predatory fish that hunts at night in deep tropical waters.

Animals.name: Trumpetfish

Animals.description: A slender reef fish that camouflages among corals and stalks smaller fish.

Animals.name: Harvestfish

Animals.description: A small, silvery fish found in estuaries and shallow coastal waters.

Animals.name: Prowfish

Animals.description: A rare deep-sea fish from the North Pacific, with a unique eel-like body.

Animals.name: Ragfish

Animals.name: Red Lionfish

Animals.description: A venomous reef fish with striking striped patterns, known for its invasive spread in the Atlantic.

Animals.name: Black Rockfish

Animals.name: Kelp Bass

Animals.description: A coastal fish of the Pacific, often living among kelp beds and rocky areas.

Animals.name: Southern Cassowary

Animals.name: Common Snook

Animals.description: A prized game fish found in warm coastal waters and mangroves.

Animals.name: Gafftopsail Catfish

Animals.description: A coastal catfish with venomous spines, common in the Gulf of Mexico.

Animals.name: Golden Shiner
